This question requires basic arithmetic knowledge. To determine the length of summer the boy has to endure, we need to convert the given time periods into the same unit of measurement. Since the options are given in weeks, we need to convert the other time periods into weeks as well. 

If we convert three years to weeks, we know that there are 52 weeks in a year, so three years would be 52 x 3 = 156 weeks. 

If we convert nine months to weeks, we know that there are approximately 4.33 weeks in a month, so nine months would be 4.33 x 9 = 39 weeks. 

If we convert two days to weeks, we know that there are 7 days in a week, so two days would be 2/7 = 0.285 weeks. 

Therefore, the option with the shortest time period is (A) twelve weeks, which is the correct answer. The other options have longer time periods, so the boy would have to endure summer for a longer duration.
